abstract.p: Calendar of upcoming events in Atlanta's eight-month festival celebrating black experience in America (S)

block.p: An eight-month arts festival about the black experience in America, which began in January, has a full calendar of events in spring and summer. ''Spirit and Splendor: A Celebration of the Sights, Sounds and Soul of African American Arts and Culture'' is being presented by the Woodruff Arts Center in Atlanta. Music, drama and dance performances and art exhibitions are being staged at museums and cultural centers throughout the city. The festival will run through Sept. 24.

A central component is the exhibition ''To Conserve a Legacy: American Art from Historically Black Colleges and Universities,'' to be shown at the High Museum of Art and Clark Atlanta University from June 20 to Sept. 24. Other exhibitions include ''From Africa to America: Honoring our Ancestors,'' June 1 to Nov. 11 at the Atlanta International Museum, and ''The David C. Driskell Collection: Narratives of African American Art of the Twentieth Century,'' from June 13 to Sept. 24 at the High Museum of Art.

Performances include a concert by the jazz pianist Billy Taylor at the Rialto Center on May 20, dance by Ballethnic at East Point Auditorium on May 20 and dramas by Dael Orlandersmith, Billy Hicks Jr. and Rebecca Ranson.

The ''Spirit and Splendor'' celebration of black culture also includes city-sponsored events. The Atlanta Jazz Festival runs from May 22 to 29 at Piedmont Park, followed by the Montreaux Atlanta Music Festival from Aug. 28 to Sept. 4, with an array of jazz, hip-hop, rhythm and blues, soul, rock and blues.
